results.title: Metformin attenuates alveolar bone destruction in mice with apical periodontitis and inhibits pro-inflammatory cytokine synthesis in lipopolysaccharide-stimulated RAW264.7 through the AMPK-mTOR-NF-kappaB pathway.
results.text_hl: Results: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Periapical_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010483 @@@periapical bone destruction@@@ on postoperative days 21 and 28, and decreased the number of osteoclasts on the periapical alveolar bone on postoperative day 28.

citations.NLM: Ren C, Tazawa K, Kawashima N, Ohshima R, Okada Y, Wang S, Yu Z, Han P, Ohsugi Y, Katagiri S, Okiji T. Metformin attenuates alveolar bone destruction in mice with apical periodontitis and inhibits pro-inflammatory cytokine synthesis in lipopolysaccharide-stimulated RAW264.7 through the AMPK-mTOR-NF-kappaB pathway. Front Immunol. 2025;16():1643676. PMID: 40821823

results.title: Metformin reduced the alkaline resistance of Enterococcus faecalis against calcium hydroxide via Man-PTS EII: in vitro and in vivo studies.
results.text_hl: Additionally, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Calcium_Hydroxide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002126 @@@CH@@@ showed the synergistically promoted intra-canal E. faecalis infection control and healing of @<m>DISEASE_Periapical_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010483 @@@periapical lesion@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.
